sub_topic: Calculating the circumference of a circle.
message_1: A circular pond has a radius of 8 meters. What is its circumference?
message_2:
The circumference of a circle is given by the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius of the circle. In this case, the radius of the circular pond is 8 meters.

C = 2π(8)
C = 16π

The circumference of the circular pond is 16π meters, which is approximately 50.27 meters.
